title: Investors Bet Oil Still Has Room to Run After Touching $100
summary: The price advance adds pressure on a global economy grappling with surging inflation. On Wall Street, there is a bet that $100 oil is just the beginning.

title: BP to Exit From Stake in Russia's Rosneft Following Pressure From U.K.
summary: Divestment follows talk between CEO and U.K. official, could result in substantial loss. British energy giant BP PLC said Sunday it will exit its nearly 20% stake in Russian government-controlled oil producer Rosneft , days after it was pressured to unload the holding by U.K. officials amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Should the U.S. Government Subsidize Domestic Chip Production? Two Advocates Square Off.
summary: Some see an urgent need for help, others no need at all. The U.S. share of global semiconductor-manufacturing capacity has declined sharply over the past three decades, fueling concerns about American reliance on imports for chips that are crucial to the economy and national security.

title: Roman Abramovich, a Russian Mystery in London, Moves to Shield His Prize Soccer Asset
summary: The billionaire owner of Chelsea in the Premier League transferred stewardship-but not ownership-of the club to the team's charitable foundation. LONDON-When Roman Abramovich landed in London in 2003 with the intention to buy one of the city's soccer clubs, all the sellers knew about him was what they found in a cursory Google search. He was Russian. He had made a fortune running the Sibneft energy company. And he had ties to Russian President Vladimir Putin.

title: What CEOs Are Saying: 'There's Higher Cyberattack Sensitivity'
summary: Leaders from Home Depot, Block, Zscaler and other companies share their thoughts about the Ukraine, inflation and the consumer. Here is a look at what some of the world's corporate leaders said on their earnings conference calls last week about the situation in Ukraine, inflation and the consumer.

title: Wall Street Takes Crypto Lead
summary: Hedge funds, registered investment advisers and some companies step up their stakes in cryptocurrencies as the market becomes more mainstream. Professional investors have been surging into crypto at record rates.

title: What Should We Do With the Big Technology Companies?
summary: On one side, there are those who call for more regulation. But others insist that would be a terrible mistake. Three experts debate the issue.. The online world is playing an ever-larger role in people's lives, especially in the wake of the pandemic. And an astonishing amount of this technology is run by a handful of companies.

title: Why Age Verification Is So Difficult for Websites
summary: The more rigorous the systems are, the more privacy issues they create. But AI offers a possible solution.. As parents, lawmakers and activists push for stronger rules to keep children off websites meant for adults, the question of how to verify age online has taken on new urgency. More sites are asking users to certify they are over 18, and companies are rolling out innovations aimed at better age checks.

title: Ukraine Crisis Upends Investing Playbook for 2022
summary: Markets from wheat to oil and stocks are recording some of their most extreme swings of the past two decades. Global markets for everything from stocks to oil to wheat are recording some of the most extreme price swings in decades, a sign of investor unease over unpredictable economic and political dynamics.

title: Global Air Travel Disrupted by Invasion of Ukraine
summary: Delta cancels code-sharing deal with Russian flag carrier Aeroflot as London and Moscow exchange bans on each other's air traffic. Competing aviation sanctions and the narrowing of airspace available for commercial travel over Russia and Eastern Europe are adding strain on the global aviation industry, which is just starting to emerge from two years of travel restrictions related to Covid-19.
